At its five locations in the city, the Coffee Collective perfectly nails the style, vibe, and flavor profile of what you imagine a Scandinavian coffee shop to be. Hit the Jægersborggade location to anchor a morning on one of the city’s coolest streets; venture to the Godthåbsvej location to check out the roastery; and try the smallest shop on Bernikow, which is dark and clubby like the old-man’s bar it once was. The Torvehallerne spot is a good place to refuel, and the newest location is at Broens Gadekøkken, a food market started by Noma's ownersPRACTICAL STUFF: Each location has different hours, so visit the website beforehand.—Christine MuhlkeWE ALSO LOVEDemocratic CoffeeOne more reason to love the library (or at least this Indre By one): buttery croissantsLa BanchinaGet real R&R in at this Amager Harbor vegetable-focused restaurant with a few surprisesAndersen & Maillard Forget all about Paris and its croissants at this spare Nørrebro bakeryExplore City GuidesAtlantaAustinBostonCharlestonChicagoCopenhagenLas VegasLondonLos AngelesMexico CityMiamiMontrealNew OrleansNew YorkParisPhiladelphiaPortlandSan FranciscoSeattleTokyoTorontoVancouverWashington, D.C.GET THE MAGAZINEBA LogoBon appetitSUBSCRIBESign up for Updates on the Bon AppétitCity GuidesSign UpWill be used in accordance with our user agreement and privacy policyBA LogoBon appetitSubscription FAQsMastheadNewsletter SignupAccessibility HelpRSS FeedsSite MapCondé Nast StoreCareersBon Appétit Media KitDo Not Sell My Personal InformationCondé NastFood Innovation Group: Bon Appétit and Epicurious© 2022 Condé Nast.
